Win or Loss Reasons- (New CRM PickList): Data Coverage Did Not Meet Requirements
Definitions: Required macroeconomic series, geographies, frequencies, or history were unavailable.
Cont/UnCont Definitions: Influenced by data acquisition strategy and roadmap, but rarely fixable in-cycle.

Win or Loss Reasons- (New CRM PickList): Platform Usability or Data Structure Limitations
Definitions: Data format, metadata, or organization did not support the client’s workflow.
Cont/UnCont Definitions: Directly tied to product design, UX, and enablement.

Definitions: Charting, modeling, or analytical features were insufficient for intended use cases.
Cont/UnCont Definitions: Product functionality, roadmap prioritization, and positioning.

Win or Loss Reasons- (New CRM PickList): AI Capabilities Did Not Meet Expectations
Definitions: Customer required AI-driven functionality that was missing, weaker, or less trusted than alternatives.
Cont/UnCont Definitions: Feature design, augmentation value, intelligence provided

Definitions: Limited interoperability with internal tools (Excel, Python, BI tools, proprietary systems).
Cont/UnCont Definitions: APIs, integrations, security posture can be improved, but client IT policies vary.

Definitions: Client IT policies prevented installation, access, or cloud usage.
Cont/UnCont Definitions: APIs, integrations, security posture can be improved, but client IT policies vary.

Win or Loss Reasons- (New CRM PickList): Insufficient Business Value Relative to Cost
Definitions: Customer did not perceive sufficient incremental value to justify purchase.
Cont/UnCont Definitions: Sales messaging, use-case framing, ROI articulation.

Definitions: Budget unavailable or pricing exceeded acceptable thresholds.
Cont/UnCont Definitions: Pricing, packaging, and deal structure help, but budgets may be fixed.

Definitions: Customer chose a competitor, internal solution, or alternative provider.
Cont/UnCont Definitions: Competitive positioning matters, but outcomes depend on buyer strategy.

Definitions: Customer opted to rely on in-house data, models, or tooling.
Cont/UnCont Definitions: Standard terms, data licensing, and legal responsiveness can reduce friction.

Definitions: Data licensing, regulatory, or compliance concerns could not be resolved.
Cont/UnCont Definitions: Standard terms, data licensing, and legal responsiveness can reduce friction.

Definitions: Legal, procurement, or commercial terms stalled or blocked approval.
Cont/UnCont Definitions: Standard terms, data licensing, and legal responsiveness can reduce friction.

Old PickList (for mapping): Timing – Due to change in scope
Definitions: Project objectives changed or were deprioritized.
Cont/UnCont Definitions: External business dynamics and personnel changes.

Definitions: Champion left, team restructured, or ownership changed.
Cont/UnCont Definitions: External business dynamics and personnel changes.

Definitions: Adequate licenses already available internally.
Cont/UnCont Definitions: Already satisfied demand; no net-new need.

Definitions: Customer reduced overall usage footprint.
Cont/UnCont Definitions: Onboarding, customer success, outcomes

Definitions: Did not meet qualification criteria (authority, need, timing).
Cont/UnCont Definitions: Qualification rigor and CRM hygiene are internal responsibilities.

Definitions: Opportunity closed for CRM hygiene or inactivity.
Trusted macroeconomic data with strong metadata, consistency, and reliability.
Cont/UnCont Definitions: Data sourcing, QA processes, metadata standards.

Definitions: Extensive coverage across countries, indicators, frequencies, and history.
Cont/UnCont Definitions: nfluenced by acquisition strategy and roadmap.

Definitions: Platform was easy to learn, navigate, and use effectively.
Cont/UnCont Definitions: UX design, onboarding, and product evolution.

Old PickList (for mapping): Simple Analytics, requiring no coding skills
Definitions: Users could perform analysis and modeling without programming expertise.
Cont/UnCont Definitions: Feature design, defaults, templates, training.

Definitions: Visual outputs met professional and presentation-quality standards.
Cont/UnCont Definitions: Charting engine, styling, export options.

Old PickList (for mapping): Ease of update, removal of workarounds
Definitions: Platform reduced manual work, errors, and legacy workarounds.
Cont/UnCont Definitions: Automation, update mechanisms, and workflow tooling.

Definitions: AI features materially improved speed, insight generation, or usability compared to alternatives.
Cont/UnCont Definitions: Feature design, augmentation value, intelligence provided

Win or Loss Reasons- (New CRM PickList): Integration with Existing Tools and Workflows
Definitions: Fit seamlessly into Excel, Python, BI tools, or internal systems.
Cont/UnCont Definitions: APIs, connectors, documentation, but depends on client stack.

Old PickList (for mapping): Sharing of finished work, Platform access & storage
Definitions: Enabled easy sharing, access control, and reuse across teams.
Cont/UnCont Definitions: Licensing, permissions, sharing features.

Old PickList (for mapping): Pricing – compelling value-add, Pricing – cheaper vs alternatives)
Definitions: Pricing was justified by value delivered relative to alternatives.
Cont/UnCont Definitions: Pricing, packaging, and value articulation.

Win or Loss Reasons- (New CRM PickList): Adopted as a Core Team Platform
Old PickList (for mapping): Need Macrobond as central tool in the team
Definitions: Platform became the standard, central macroeconomic tool for the team.
Cont/UnCont Definitions: Product breadth, adoption strategy, and account expansion.
